concept.title: Part III: Topic Types
concept.shortdesc: This module introduces core DITA topic types and their appropriate usage to improve content clarity and organization.

section.title: Learning Objectives
section.p: Upon completing this module, you will be able to:

ul.li: Explain the purpose and appropriate use cases for each of the core DITA topic types.
Identify the common structural elements (tags) associated with concept, task, reference, glossary, and troubleshooting topics.
Apply best practices for structuring content within each topic type to improve clarity and usability.
Understand how different topic types work together to form comprehensive documentation.

conbody.p: DITA defines several structured topic types, each intended for a different documentation purpose. Using the correct topic type ensures content is focused, reusable, and well-organized across deliverables. Topic types are not arbitrary categories; they reflect how users actually consume technical information. By matching content structure to user intent, DITA topics become more findable, scannable, and actionable.
